intro: Calamaria gunnii, commonly known as the Gunns' calamaria, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open coastal heathlands. Calamaria gunnii is adapted to salt spray and can tolerate moderate drought conditions.
